text: This study delves into the intricate relationships among Emotional Intelligence (EI), Artificial Intelligence (AI), and Investment Decisions (ID) within the evolving landscape of financial decision-making. It aims to uncover the direct impact of human emotional intelligence on investment choices and the mediating role played by AI in this process. Through empirical analysis, the study unveils that EI not only directly affects ID but also influences it indirectly through AI-mediated pathways. These findings emphasize the significant role of emotional awareness in investor decision-making, supported by the technological advancements in AI. The study suggests that emotional intelligence has a substantial influence on investors' decisions, with AI acting as a partial mediator in the relationship between emotional intelligence and investment decisions. This nuanced understanding provides crucial insights for financial practitioners and policymakers, advocating for holistic strategies that integrate emotional and technological aspects in navigating modern investment challenges.
name: new-048
